reviews.text: I stayed with my family for 2 nights in July 2013.
reviews.title: Paris Disney trip 26th July

reviews.text: Good decor. Clean and spacious rooms. Nice good quality furnishings and perfect beds!!!
reviews.title: Beware - Worst hotel in the world!

reviews.text: The hotel staff at the reception, house keeping, restaurant booking, luggage storage were very courteous and ever willing to help.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: The hotel is just 15 minutes away from the park and their is free shuttle bus service from and to the park. (this takes more than 20mins)
reviews.title: Stay at Disney's Sequoia Lodge

reviews.text: The hotel does not have free wifi which was missed.
reviews.title: Heartbreakingly awful

reviews.text: Our family stayed for 5 days at the end of August. On checking in, we received a complimentary breakfast voucher for one morning in the Golden Forest Lounge. This was the same breakfast as everywhere else - however the key differences being it was quieter and more relaxed, and characters came round your table. This was excellent for the kids. This meant no long queues for photos. Our kids enjoyed this so much that we paid for an upgrade on our last morning, €36 for two adults two kids.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.text: We stayed in a lodge and found the room perfectly adequate, and to a three star standard. The lodge rooms were a few pounds cheaper than the main hotel montana rooms, and we didnt see any benefit of staying in the main hotel as the whole place is massive.
reviews.title: Brilliant pool

reviews.text: We used the pool one evening and yes it is cold but ok for a half hour fun with the kids. The slide proved a hit too.
reviews.title: Second time at Sequoia Lodge

reviews.text: Location to Disney is an easy 10-15 min walk.
reviews.title: Good base for Disneyland

reviews.text: Its hard to get a decent meal in Disney. Our best meal was in the Rainforest Cafe, but it was expensive.
reviews.title: Good fun, slow bar service, good half board option.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed previously in 2008 and had a great view of the lake and castle, hoping for a similar room again we booked a lake view Montana room.
reviews.title: Poor value for money

reviews.text: Check in was very slow, large queue which didn't seem very organised but eventually we got our room.
reviews.title: Couldn't fault it

reviews.text: On getting into our room we were very impressed, large room with a balcony on the corner of the main building. Unfortunately the view we got from the balcony was just trees, and a little bit of a lake. Although technically a lake view I don't think the room should be classed as one as all you could really see without leaning over was trees. Nice but not what we booked.
reviews.title: Golden Forest Club

reviews.text: The balcony had also not been cleaned for a very long time as it had cigarette butts all over it. Not that nice for a non smoking hotel!
reviews.title: Best Disney Hotel
Dreadful, aweful, must avoid at all costs.
reviews.text: The room was large but had the same amount and style of furniture as a standard room, this meant the TV was a bit useless from the bed and any menus meant a walk over to have a closer inspection.
Stayed for sun-thursday(less busy days) with 3 year old and 6 month old.
reviews.title: Golden Forest, a lot of money but if you want characters and get a deal it makes sense

reviews.text: Location is near park, variance vs New York(our alternative thought) isn't much and close enough not to justify premium.
reviews.title: Great base for the parks

reviews.text: Went for golden forest which worked so well for us we have already rebooked. Benefit less busy breakfast (more limited range than i wxpected but had yoghurts,toast,bread,cheese ham etc , some fruit and you can order bacon and sausage for approx 4 euros.) primary benefit is characters we had breakfast with eeyore, tigger, Minnie(camping outfit), Donald(camping outfit) goofy.
reviews.title: Breakfast service... the horror attraction

reviews.text: Eeyore was very good with our 6 month old who was surprisingly excited by the characters.
reviews.title: Amazing stay at sequoia lodge. Ignore the bad reviews. We had a blast.

reviews.text: Breakfasts arent too busy, If you are in at the right time you may get a character to yourself but you will generally get a few minutes vs seconds in the park. And given how awfully managed the characters are in the park vs states (rugby scrum/ push in / no queues) this is great as you don't need to waste time in the parks on queuing.
reviews.title: Nothing special - overpriced Disney premium!
